query:
INSERT INTO paradoxes (title, paradoxStatement, teacherPerspectives) VALUES
('The Paradox of Solitude', 'You must be alone to find yourself, yet you can only know yourself in relationship with others.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'The Buddha taught that true self-knowledge comes through meditation and inner observation, yet emphasized the sangha (community) as essential to enlightenment.'))),
('The Paradox of Death', 'You must accept that you will die, yet you must live as if you will live forever.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Stoics like Marcus Aurelius used death contemplation to live more fully, while also planning for a long life.'))),
('The Paradox of Surrender', 'You must surrender your will to a higher power, yet you must also take full responsibility for your choices.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'The Bhagavad Gita teaches both surrender to dharma and personal responsibility for action.'))),
('The Paradox of Effort', 'You must work hard to achieve enlightenment, yet enlightenment is the realization that there is nothing to achieve.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Zen Buddhism teaches that striving paradoxically prevents realization, yet practice is necessary.'))),
('The Paradox of Control', 'You must control your mind, yet the more you try to control it, the more it resists.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Taoism teaches wu wei (non-action) - the paradox of achieving through non-striving.'))),
('The Paradox of Desire', 'You must want nothing to be happy, yet you must desire growth and virtue.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Stoicism distinguishes between destructive desires and virtuous aspirations.')));
command:
mysql --batch --raw --column-names --default-character-set=utf8mb4 --host gateway02.us-east-1.prod.aws.tidbcloud.com --port 4000 --user 4PQbAAV1fA3eoWB.9bb51d851611 --database my7vf9kVVC5tHsnhvudijY --execute INSERT INTO paradoxes (title, paradoxStatement, teacherPerspectives) VALUES
('The Paradox of Solitude', 'You must be alone to find yourself, yet you can only know yourself in relationship with others.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'The Buddha taught that true self-knowledge comes through meditation and inner observation, yet emphasized the sangha (community) as essential to enlightenment.'))),

('The Paradox of Effort', 'You must work hard to achieve enlightenment, yet enlightenment is the realization that there is nothing to achieve.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Zen Buddhism teaches that striving paradoxically prevents realization, yet practice is necessary.'))),
('The Paradox of Control', 'You must control your mind, yet the more you try to control it, the more it resists.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Taoism teaches wu wei (non-action) - the paradox of achieving through non-striving.'))),
('The Paradox of Desire', 'You must want nothing to be happy, yet you must desire growth and virtue.', JSON_ARRAY(JSON_OBJECT('perspective', 'Stoicism distinguishes between destructive desires and virtuous aspirations.')));
